website_summaries.verdict: Concentrated formula if you're looking to kill weeds but not necessarily prevent them. Otherwise, consider alternatives on our shortlist.
pros: Effectively kills most weeds and unwanted grass
1 gallon makes up to 85 gallons of mix
Some users claim one jug lasts for up to 2 years
cons: takes several days to a week to kill weeds
May not kill some robust weeds

website_summaries.verdict: Made with 41% Glyphosate and concentrated to last, this highly effective and affordable formula works on most weeds, grasses, and crabgrass.
pros: Effective on crabgrass and other weeds
ft. Begins to work in as little as 2 days
cons: May require a higher concentration to kill some types of grasses

customer_reviews.title: It's glyphosate, it kills weeds (and nearly everything else), requires care and patience.
customer_reviews.text: It's glyphosate, it kills weeds. Vastly cheaper than buying readymade, stupidly dilute off the shelf products. Even with buying this and a gallon sprayer, you're saving money (and getting better results) on your second spraying. Just remember, it's glyphosate, so you need to be careful, and patient. Mix to the recommended strength - there's no advantage to making it stronger. Spray on a dry day without a strong breeze, ideally early in the morning. The weeds will transpire during the day sucking in all the glyphosate, and will start to shrivel within two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Pink

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Roundup, but I loved the idea of saving money with an "off brand" concentrate. Turns out money was wasted, not saved, because this product does nothing at all. My weeds simply laughed at it and continued on their way. I don't know where all these 5-star reviews are coming from!
customer_reviews.author: Stuff & Things

customer_reviews.title: I give this product a A+++. It simply works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product as directed on my half acre lot and it worked perfectly. I grew a lot of weeds overtime due to not tending to the yard like I needed. I was simply frustrated and wanted to start over, and so I did with this product. It took 2 days to see the results, and it was noticeable! The grass and weeds looked as if I took a torch to them. My entire yard was brown. I waited 2 weeks prior to aerating and reseeding, which my yard is back to being the best in the neighborhood. I give this product a A+++, and for the price, you cannot go wrong!!!
customer_reviews.author: ronald fisher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I made the mixture a little more concentrated then recommend. Within a week they were all dried up and dead! Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Andres Davila

customer_reviews.title: Beware!  Some batches simply don't work.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this product over a year ago. It seemed to work fine, more-or-less comparable to Round-up (having the same active ingredient: 41% glyphosate). When I bought another gallon of concentrate last month, the results were terrible. Some leafy plants became yellow, but it had no effect on the grass. I had to respray the entire area with real Round-up. I conclude that the manufacturing process has terrible quality control...consistent with the idea that they don't have much of a brand to protect. Unless your time is free and you can afford to roll the dice, avoid this product. I'll never buy from "Compare-n-Save" again.
customer_reviews.author: William Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff - Buy it - Takes longer but totally works
customer_reviews.text: For that price, you really can't beat it. Live in Nevada, tough weeds, was a little skeptical, but it killed everything I sprayed. From what I can gather, it does not have the other chemical which is far more harmful, hence it takes longer for the weeds to die. And die they did, have acres of totally dead weeds, followed the mix examples on packaging. So, will take a week, week and a half to show progress, but I promise you this works as well as terrible Roundup, just takes a bit longer. Combined it with "Mark it Blue" product, which was a lot of fun and showed me exactly where I sprayed so I didn't waste any.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT kill ANYTHING!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because of the MANY positive reviews. I sprayed THREE days ago & there is no evidence that it has affected the grass/weeds AT ALL! EVERYTHING that I sprayed is just as green as it was BEFORE I sprayed. Lesson learned: DO NOT believe reviews. I will NEVER order this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: DON NOT BUY!!!  DOES NOT WORK!!!  JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute junk!!! IT simply does not work!!! I just read another 1 Star review which stated "All I did was basically wash the weeds" and I laughed, because I though the same thing. I have now missed my window or return waiting four weeks for this product to work. This product has been sprayed on the weeds twice in the past four months at two different strengths that are both higher than the "Tough Weeds" mixture and the weeds are full and green. I sprayed Roundup on another area of the same type of greenery and they were brown and dead in under a week. DO NOT BUT THIS WORTHLESS PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig S.

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are worth a thousand words
customer_reviews.text: these pictures were taken 2-2.5 weeks apart. I use a hose end sprayer I picked up at Home Depot. Great product at great price.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Really good stuff even without adding surfactant!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small landscape company and have been using this product recently with great results. 2.5 gallons for $30??? I was skeptical but it does an amazing job when mixed at 5% (6.5 oz per gallon of water), pictures I included were at a new property and we wanted to put Pinestraw around the shrubs but needed to kill all the seeds and grass that had grown around them, these photos were taken 12 days after application.
customer_reviews.author: Ben C.

customer_reviews.title: even kills poison ivy
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Used it to spray food plots and overgrowth in a heavy tree area and it even killed the very thick and heavy poison ivy. I put a few drops of dawn in the mixture to help cut through the plants oils and it has worked very well. Only thing is do not cut area short and then spray it will not work well. Leave plants as they are and spray it will have more sugar area on the plants foliage to soak in. Made the mistake of cutting one of my food plots short before spraying and it didn't work. My mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Christian DiForti

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: Highest marks from someone who spent way too much on weed killers. I was impatient and thought I was just watering my weeds after not seeing results in 3 days, the weeds were still vibrant after 5 days. I was about to give this a bad review but after 7 days, the weeds all started turning brown and after two weeks, all dead. I tried everything at Home Depot, even a weed torch. It all came back within a week. Only the weeds I missed spraying or new ones I didnt see before are growing. It’s now 3 weeks, 2nd pic is all dead weeds except for a few I misses.
customer_reviews.author: ValinTempe

customer_reviews.title: This has been far better than the brand name version you buy at your ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been far better than the brand name version you buy at your local hardware store. You simply dilute this to the ratio specs on the bottle. A little goes a long way. I used a 1.5 gallon pump water sprayer. You can apply a very large area in a fast amount of time. I found this to be just as effective as the brand name weed killer BUT you do have to be more patient. You will not see the results in the first few days. It took probably 2-3 weeks before it looked like it killed where I sprayed. I am in no hurry, especially when the price is a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Weed killer doesn twork
customer_reviews.text: I have a backyard full of weeds and sprayed them weeks ago with the weed killer. They are still living strong, I have tried to spray them again and have the same result. This weed killer claimed to be really good, but i dont see it working. I am unhappy with this product and now need to search for another one.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: No way this can be 41%!
customer_reviews.text: Mixed a little stronger than recommended for lawn Reno. I mixed 6 Tablespoons per gallon, the same concentrate ratio in Roundup. No rain for 2 days after application. 2 weeks later, no change in grass or weeds. Always had results from Roundup in 2 weeks. Something fishy about all these positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Milo Robertson

customer_reviews.title: This product does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weed and grass killer because it was an Amazon favorite and had pretty decent reviews. I have used it as the directions specify and it does not kill grass or weeds. I waited a week after the first application and then hit the weeds again and still nothing. I would say that less than 10% of the weeds (after two weeks and two applications) are showing a little wilting. The other 90% of grass and weeds are growing faster than ever. Very disappointed. I am going to try a new grass and weed killer as this does not work!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Did absolutely nothing. Followed the instructions and sprayed the same small weeds and grass for a week, and nothing. Raised the dosage and nothing. Then I literally dumped several cups of the unmixed, concentrated liquid over several of the same exact weeds (with a week's worth of poison) and two days later they were as green and obnoxious as ever. Finally, after another few days, my neighbor showed up with a much lower concentration of RoundUp grass and weed killer (same active ingredients) and the weeds were wilting and drying up within hours. I must have gotten a bad batch or something, given the reviews, but just be warned that this didn't work at all for me.
customer_reviews.author: ozozznozzy

customer_reviews.title: Not working at all
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what changed but this is not working for me at all! I used this a few years ago and I’m not sure if they changed the formula but it’s not doing anything for me at all and I’m using it at almost full strength
customer_reviews.author: StephenShu

customer_reviews.title: Here is what the outside shipping container looked like the inside container look worse and was saturated with ...
customer_reviews.text: Came in a leaky container. Person that left the package could clearly see that the container was leaking and left a mess on my driveway. I suspect this was left upside down for a long period of time. either that or there is a small hole in the container. At any rate I did not get a complete container of the product and feel that it should be replaced. Here is what the outside shipping container looked like the inside container look worse and was saturated with concentrate.
customer_reviews.author: DB2071

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price if you're patient
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, but it takes several days. I usually add 1/4 cup of Spectracide to each gallon of mix in my sprayer along with a good squirt of dish soap (so the mix sticks to the weeds) to hasten the process. Weeds dead in 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a 6 months control - KILL EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. Does it jobs in killing everything. Some takes 1 week, some takes 2 weeks, but they all die. The weeds does come back in 6 months. But one application lasts 6 months is really good already. Would recommend for the value. Be careful to wear a face mask and long sleeves and don't get this stuff on you.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Vo

customer_reviews.title: Really clean weeds now. Should have used gasoline
customer_reviews.text: Tried instructions on container. Tried mixing 90 percent to 10 percent water. Poured on strait. Nothing. Either i have strongest weeds in the world or this stuff doesnt work. I would not recommend to anyone. Weeds didnt even turn color. Was basiically like incleaned them
customer_reviews.author: HunShel

customer_reviews.title: Best product for the job.
customer_reviews.text: The review is about the effectiveness of the product. Weed and grass killer is the last resort one should use if the natural ways are not working so I wouldn't recommend using it if you have little bit of weed problem. But if you really need to kill the weeds and grass then this is it and it's because of 41% glyphosate. Other similar products have very less amount of glyphosate and that is the main ingredient to kill the weeds. Last week I used this product after almost 7-8 months, it tooks 3-4 days to see the full effect but it did it's job. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: verified buyer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy - Does Not Work!
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy Round up and after reading reviews I thought this could save me some money. Well I was wrong. The first spray I went off the directions and mixed it how it said too. A week went past and not sign of anything dying. So I tried again and mixed it alot stronger a few days past and 50% of what I sprayed is wilted but not dead. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: kg310

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, this product did not show any weeds affected despite a second application a few days later. I have a large terraced area and had someone apply the product, took 2 days to complete first application. We both watched for signs of weeds dying and there was none. We had to eventually remove weeds manually, another 2 days spent. Not one area or weed was was eliminated using the concentrated weed killer and we use the more concentrated mixture as directions indicated. This product cost me a lot of money as I purchased the product, paid for someone to apply times two and then had to pay to have the weeds pooled. Please beware this product is useless.
customer_reviews.author: pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Being patient is an understatement.
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews, thought I'd try this and save myself $$ from other brands and company quotes. But holy crap, I tested this out at various strengths, and it took, maybe 2 whole weeks (if not more) to see a difference. Round-up and the like was a lot more instant. I have no idea how to return a jug of nothing, so I thought to just keep remaining patient. Some weeds, poison ivy, poison oak, and privet have finally browned, but I know I'll have to keep after them all summer. But yeah, you REALLY are going to have to be patient. I'm not sure if there's a better formula out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amz.Verified

customer_reviews.title: did not work!
customer_reviews.text: this product didn't work for me. I ordered it bcz of all the great reviews... well this didn't work for me. I followed instructions too.. the next time i just sprayed the stuff without deluting it! waiting to see if it works..:-( I'll tell you what does work, it's RM-43.. more expensive but definitely works. One spray of weeds will last till the following year.. I'll buy that again today!
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work very well at twice the strength.
customer_reviews.text: My latest Roundup which I bought online did nothing, so I used this concentrate and made it twice the recommended strength. There's some browning in spots, but looks like I'm going to have to pull weeds by hand. Am I getting water or overly diluted products? I tried all the green recipes online, but they didn't work. Roundup used to work, so what's the difference? They need to seal the product and package the dispenser separately so purchasers know the product wasn't tampered with. I regularly shook the bottle and my sprayer in case the product needed agitation to keep it in suspension, so that wasn't the problem.
customer_reviews.author: a lesson learned

customer_reviews.title: This is a killer spray
customer_reviews.text: Revising my review. This is probably the most potent plant killer I've used. It just takes at least 2-3 days to see any kind of effect; then 2 more weeks to see the plants fully die. This is unlike other plant/weed killers where the effect is quicker but less potent. Previously:I followed the directions to the letter and sprayed plants area twice. There has been absolutely no effect on the plants. Nothing !!! At the very least, I hoped some spotting or dead leaves. Nothing !!! I wish I can return it because now I have to carry the burden of disposing of it by taking it to a collection center. Stay away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Polo

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is my first bad review ever! I waited a while to post this because I wanted to give it a fair shot. After the first application, I didn't see any results, so I double checked my mix ratio and applied it a second time, after a week still no results. I mixed it up a little stronger for the third application, and applied it much heavier. It has now been over two weeks since the first application, still nothing I mean not even a wilting blade of grass! you can not even tell where it was applied, on grass, and weeds, nothing no effect what soever. Back to high price R up.
customer_reviews.author: scott wright

customer_reviews.title: Complete rip off
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless. I first used another product. It did nothing, then saw this product that was supposed to be ten times stronger than the other product. I mixed the concentrate as directed. It did absolutely nothing. Finally I poured straight concentrate on the weeds. The result? Absolutely nothing. Weeds are growing great. Do not waste your money on this. Complete rip off
customer_reviews.author: Marnie Blake

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work, AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked, It didn't work, I mean like NOT AT ALL. I used as directed,...I doubled the amount, didn'twork,.... I tripled it, IT DIDN'T WORK... I am just going to use it straight and see if there are any results. I still have a gallon left that I can't dump, or use, what the heck? I don't know whether it got frozen or they just sell garbage. I won't take a chance again.... what a WASTE OF MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stormsailor1

customer_reviews.title: It KILLS!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about ordering this, but excuse my french, this SH*T works! I didn't use 3/4 spoon, rather i did a bit more to make sure it kills the weed that i've been struggling with for years. THEY ARE DEAD! OMG. I used about 8-10 oz or may be a bit more with a gallon spray and wallaaaaah. It DOES exactly what it says!! I didn't spray it 1 day, but i went around spraying my whole yard 3 days and it killed them weeds. DO NOT spray it in the middle of the day when the sun is out there...rather do it towards end of the day .. it works better. Also, don't do b4 or after rain.
customer_reviews.author: La La

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but not immediately.
customer_reviews.text: First time using this brand, but I have used other concentrates in the past. I used to mix a large amount in to kill Virginia creeper, poison oak, poison ivy, etc. I would see initial effects in just a day or two. This time, I used much less, as I was not targeting those hearty plants. I did not see results quickly, but I am seeing results. Things are dying where I sprayed. It has been a week, but I'm not worried about the timeline, just the end result. If you want things to die faster, mix a stronger batch; otherwise, be patient and save money by mixing weaker. I used 4 or 5 oz per gallon.
customer_reviews.author: Vince Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Crap don't buy
customer_reviews.text: 41% glyphosate should kill the weeds with no problem. I made a strong batch 6 oz per 2 gallons. Sprayed weeds on a nice warm day without any wind. Gave the weeds a good spray. 24hrs later nothing, green as can be. 4 days later nothing! One Week later, nothing!! This stuff is crap. You get what you pay for. Be warned, do not buy this crap!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S.

customer_reviews.title: not effective
customer_reviews.text: i am a pro. lic. applicator and just moved to another state so i ordered this to try versus crossbow or ranger pro which is pricey but very effective, after broadcasting and heavy application with a stronger ratio and 3 dry days nothing except new growth. i will buy ranger pro and get it done right.
customer_reviews.author: lynda james

customer_reviews.title: Dont but, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I think its just colored water. I got this on Sunday. Today is Wednesday. And by the pics yoy can't see anthing has even wilted. Sunday I sprayed how it was recommended. Tuesday, I tripled the product to water. Today I'm just going to spray straight product. I don't know if you can see in the pics but there's even some grass there thats still standing like i haven't done a thing to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: No weeds in the box... So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but there were no weeds in the box when I opened the shipment, and there are STILL no weeds in the Compare-N-Save Concentrate Grass and Weed Killer, 41-Percent Glyphosate, 1-Gallon container. Whew! So far, so good. Ease of use? Super easy. Twist open after pushing down. Mix with water and pour on plants. Death. Value for money? As of today, the value for money is about $1 per .89 Euro. Fluctuates a lot though, what with Trump's tariffs and all. Presentation. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rench

customer_reviews.title: Good and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: As a professional land scaper I've tried many many different types of weed killer, that said most all work if you make the mix strong enough! This stuff actually killed baby palm trees with 4oz mixed into 1 gallon, pretty impressive to me since every type of round up I've used even the blue "professional concentrate" bottle takes allot to kill palms! At 1/4 the price of the blue round up bottle it's a no brainer! Huge savings for my small business!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony A

customer_reviews.title: Save so much money and it really works!
customer_reviews.text: Best Sh*t ever! Weeds are gone for 6 months easy! I did the math compared to the store brands, you can make 64 gallons of weed killer at 2oz per gallon of the concentrate from Compare & Save! The store brand weed killers use 2% glyphosphate and you have to spray every 1-3 months and use a gallon every time for a modest-sized yard! What a ripoff! At 20.00 per gallon of RoundUp, you're saving hundreds of dollars! This stuff will last you years! You can spray the entire neighborhoods yards too! Best stuff ever.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cappiello3

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed - Only turned yellow and didn't die!
customer_reviews.text: Sprayed around the garden and weeds around the property. A week later they have only turned yellow. Two weeks later some are still yellow and some have regained their green and are growing again, NOTHING DIED. I used 3 oz. in a gallon of rain water and I am very disappointed in the performance as compared to the Roundup I have use in the past. I will be spending the extra money for the Roundup in the future. Look like some of the other reviewers are having the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Digitizer

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I was super super skeptical of this actually working because some reviews said it was trash, but i ordered it anyways instead of the name brand and gave it go for a whopping 20 bucks. I mixed in 5oz for 1 gallon a little above the directions, and lemme tell you everything I sprayed is dead. It took about 5 days to take effect, i checked the first couple days and was super discouraged. about 4-5 days in i noticed everything was dying out fast. Been a few weeks now and the weeds remain dead and gone. super impressed with it compared to even the name brand. i will purchase this again! have already recommended it to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: ashton

customer_reviews.title: Many years ago I worked as a spray tech for ...
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I worked as a spray tech for a resort, weed control was my job. This product works exactly the same as the round up I would spray. It will take two to three weeks to see the full results after spraying. This will do an outstanding job on grass type weeds, broad based weeds appear more resistant. (the same results I would obtain when I sprayed at the resort) If you have bought and sprayed round up and the weed appeared brown in a few days, additional product has been added to the mixture for a quick burn.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Virtually worthless. Have to quadruple the amount used to get any effect. Waste of money. Effectively costs more than branded item.
customer_reviews.author: J Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good weed and grass killer product. Cost per application is great. You do need to read directions and use proper amount of product per gallon of water. I have used it for Kudzu control. Kudzu is a big problem in Mississippi and is very hardy. I have found a mix of 3.5 to 4 ounces per gallon works well. It will kill it in about two weeks. You need to spray in early morning or late afternoon if possible. Ideally rain free for at least 6 hours. Lesser concentration will do fine for normal grass or weeds you wish to eradicate. This product is comparable to Roundup but more cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Eckert

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT WORK. Followed the instructions and weeds and grass are thriving instead of dying.
customer_reviews.text: Followed dilution instructions. Sprayed some weeds and grass. Waited a few days - NOTHING! Increased the ratio by quite a bit, reapplied. After 24 hours some of the leaves are wilty. The dandelions seems to be LOVING this concoction, they look happy as ever. This product needs to be used full strength perhaps. And if so, it is a terrible value. Will be more trouble than it's worth to return. I am terribly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S&S

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product on two occasions. The first time was on a gravel parking area that had been taken over with weeds. The proctologist's did a good job. It took several days before the weeds were mostly gone. I did miss a few areas and will have to apply again in those areas. The other application was around the house. This area was not weed infested but had some weeds in it. The product worked in about 5-7 days. I sprayed each weed individually. I would note that I mixed the spray according to instructions. I didn't want to mix it strong due to kids and pets.
customer_reviews.author: larry P

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Ive had weed killers in past always ended up pulling by hand until I got this stuff, this stuff is brutal I spray my brick patio and day later weeds look like they been hit by nuclear bomb, 3 months spayed twice cracks between bricks completely weed free they waont grow back ! Did side of my house where weeds grow in gravel driveway side of house, half a spray bottle 2 days later and bang they got vaporized, 4 weeks now and nothing growing back. I mixed twice what is on instructions I wanted go hardcore, used with a spray bottle I also purchased off Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: rjf2000

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good performance, but consider..
customer_reviews.text: This formulation of Glycophosphate is much less expensive than the market leader (Roundup). Compared to Roundup, this product seems to be slower acting, but much longer lasting. We have found through multiple tests that this product persists in the soil longer which can be a good quality when used carefully to remove and prevent recurrence of weeds, but not good if you plan to reseed the area soon after application.
customer_reviews.author: Quality buyer

customer_reviews.title: I buy a lot from Amazon but don't write many ...
customer_reviews.text: I buy a lot from Amazon but don't write many reviews. This product is so effective that I had to say so. You can start to see changes after 24 hours but it doesn't stop there. After a week, everything is dead. Now I just need to figure out a timeframe for prepping my lawn a planting new grass seed. This product is so potent that I'm kinda wondering if it's going to prevent the seeds from growing. :-). But I'll research and find out shat to do.
customer_reviews.author: grace_receiver

customer_reviews.title: Killed way beyond  the sprayed area
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it says it does. And what it doesn’t tell you. We used another product for years that was h available this year so we used this. Previous product we sprayed our chain link fence line in a four inch spray and that 4 “spray died. This product we were horrified. 4 inch spray it must kill everything attached to the root system. The grasses was killed 1 to 2 feet from the fence on both sides. Our neighbor was not happy with us. Thankfully she understood when we explained we did NOT spray into her yard. Just like we always had. Kills everything!! But more than your spray area.
customer_reviews.author: J, Ru

customer_reviews.title: It’s like World War III decimation but for plants
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the stuff diluted into a 2 gallon sprayer from Harbor freight for about two years, you don’t need very much diluted into the water, be extremely careful where you spray it because any overspray completely destroys whatever plans you get it on no matter how quickly you try to clean it off of a plant, it takes a solid 4 to 5 days to do anything but then completely obliterates whatever you sprayed, way better than round up that you buy at Home Depot, this is my secret to keeping a gravel driveway clear and plants from growing in my mulch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely devastating to weeds.
customer_reviews.text: I used an old weed killer sprayer container for this, followed the directions to the tee and it absolutely annihilated any semblance of weeds in my yard. This gallon container is probably a lifetime supply. My neighbors don't tend to their yard so their forest of weeds always eeks it's way into mine. I did them a solid and doubled the concentration mix in a mutually assured destruction plot and...wow...scorched earth. Add a little dishwashing soap to the mix and it adheres to every weed it touches and then eats through it like muriatic acid. Highly recommend. Would salt the earth again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: A couple of things which are rather obvious with this ...
customer_reviews.text: A couple of things which are rather obvious with this product 1. The affect on vegetation shows itself much slower than newer formulations I've used. It kills just as dead nonetheless. 2. Do not leave in your sprayer...this formulation forms a fungus/algae "slime" within a few days and will gum up your sprayer if you do. I'll probably choose a different brand next time
customer_reviews.author: hkg3k

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two gallons of this product because I have a big yard. I am disappointed so far. First time I sprayed, it did not work at all. it did rain about 6 hours after I sprayed. So I thought may be it is the rain although bottle says rain proof after 2 hours. So I sprayed a week later in a hot rain free day. This time, I used double the amount needed. Fourth day and the weeds are started to die but not there yet. Ready to use products, I see this much effect within two hours.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer333

customer_reviews.title: No more Roundup for me
customer_reviews.text: Stumbled on to this product while price shopping for the Roundup brand that I've been using for many years. Decided to take a chance. Glad I did. This stuff works fine. My google based casual research showed me that the only difference to Roundup is that they add a herbicide to Roundup. They do this not because its needed but because the consumer apparently wants to see tangible results that the product is working and the herbicide will create some wilting early in the process which can otherwise take a week or two to kill. If you are willing to just give the product time to work you can save a bundle with this product.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: Does not kill Desert Weeds
customer_reviews.text: We have a 10 acre Ranch with a lot of weeds along our gravel road. I put 1 Cup of this weed killer in a 2 Gal sprayer and soaked the weeds. It is not day 3 and they are still standing tall. Probably 4 or 5 different type and none are DEAD. Not Cool.
customer_reviews.author: FBranch

customer_reviews.title: Not The Same
customer_reviews.text: Not the same as Razor or Roundup as claimed. Spray part of the weeds with the balance of the razor I had, then mixed the same ratio with this and sprayed the balance. Two weeks later all the weeds sprayed with razor were dead or completely yellow. The compare and save were barley turning yellow and most were continuing to grow. NO WAY it is equal to Razor or round up. I'm now using twice as much of this product to do the job, no savings. I should have know better than to buy a knock off product. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money or your time
customer_reviews.text: Beyond disappointed. I spent hours last weekend spraying the weeds around the yard on a nice sunny day. I used the tough weed proportion of concentrate to water. . It did not rain until 3 days after this was generously sprayed. It’s been a little over one week and I don’t think a single weed died. Huge waste of time and money. Now I will have to place a pick up order at the local home store to repeat the spraying so my yard will be weed free next weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Novak

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all.
customer_reviews.text: After carefully following the instructions and properly measuring, I used this product on my problem areas in my yard. NOTHING happened after 1 week. Bad weeds and grass was as green as ever. Then I decided to make a much stronger dosage (gallon) and used it again. Then NOTHING happened again after another week! Still today writing this review I see all very green (bad weeds) and no dying anything at all! I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: K Marcelino

customer_reviews.title: Saves money and is highly effective to kill grass and weeds.
customer_reviews.text: This weed and grass killer is highly effective, almost too effective. It is concentrated and mixes easily with water in a sprayer to provides significant cost savings over standard store bought weed killer. This concentrate should last a few years for most homeowners with standard use. This concentrate can be deceiving because you won't notice much for a few days, then all of a sudden the weeds and grass quickly turn brown. Even spraying a small area will kill anything with a few inches around where you spray. Just give this product time to work and you will be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awesome. Note
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome. Note, it is slow-acting, not like Roundup or even spraying vinegar/salt mix on leaves. The difference is, this stuff kills the root of the problem, you just have to wait a week. I sprayed this over a problematic gravel area, two weeks later everything was dead. I sprayed this on weeds in my mulchbed, two weeks later everything was dead. Even sprayed over a forest path to clear it out, everything died. Stuff really works, just be patient. Way better in the long run!!!! Make sure you don't hit your flowers though!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL!
customer_reviews.text: WORKS REALLY WELL, TAKES A FEW DAYS TO START SEEING RESULTS, KILLED THE WEEDS/GRASS ALONG MY FENCE FOR 3 MONTHS BEFORE IT STARTED SHOWING SIGNS OF REGROWTH. ON A SIDE NOTE MY HUSBAND SPRAYED A LARGE CIRCLE IN THE FRONT YARD, I SEEN THE GRASS STARTING TO DISCOLOR WITHIN A FEW DAYS , I ASKED, WHATS WRONG WITH THE GRASS!? HIS RESPONSE WITH A DEER CAUGHT IN HEADLIGHTS LOOK " UMMMMM I WANTED TO SEE IF IT WORKED" ......YES IT DID, FOR ABOUT 3 MONTHS IT DID, A LARGE DIRT PATCH IN THE FRONT YARD.
customer_reviews.author: Liz G

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I am over run by weeds and grass. I mixed this ( I may have mixed in too much but i was desperate!!) and sprayed. The grass and weeds started to turn brown in less than 20 minutes (again it may have been because of the high concentration of the mixture). I sprayed it tonight so i will see what happens in the coming days and come back to report. crossing my fingers!!
customer_reviews.author: sugarangel

customer_reviews.title: Kills everything
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as my husband wanted to get rid of the weeds. He didn't follow the instructions (not surprised) and sprayed this product all over the year. He did this in March or so. As of now we they weeds (and the grass) have not grown back! This product kills it all. If you want to get rid of weeds (and your grass) this product is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Janell Arce

customer_reviews.title: Killz
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a new house with a big weed problem in the flower bed and surrounding forest. I decided to buy this instead of roundup from the big box store. I don't think this has a surfacant so make sure to get some or just add a drop of dish soap. At first I wasn't sure this was working because I didn't see any results after 24hrs like roundup. A week later half the stuff is dead and tough stuff well on its way. You only use a couple ounces per gallon so this will last me for a long time. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John Coltrane

customer_reviews.title: Revised review
customer_reviews.text: Got the product at the end of March and sprayed weeds on April 2. I am still waiting for it to kill my weeds. Purchased this product based on recommend of sprayer manufacturer. Would not recommend nor purchase again. As per sheet, mixed 2 1/2 oz per gal. This is a correction to my original review. I did more studies on the product and changed to strength to a better ratio. My prior product was a petroleum base product and it caused problems with my pump. This does not and it has a different method of killing the weeds in my 1 acre plus. Increasing the ratio and being more patient has produced an excellent result. Would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: It takes more than a week to work.
customer_reviews.text: This product works...eventually. The manufacturer needs to be honest about how long it takes, and they will have fewer disappointed customers. I cut the area on my mower's lowest setting and bagged it instead of mulching. Went over with my blower, to really clear it out. After a week, weeds and grass were slightly faded but that's about it. I returned this product after a week (8 days actually). Well, after almost two weeks, it looks like things actually died. I might give it another try. Now that I see how long it takes for it to work, I might give it another try.
customer_reviews.author: Splorer

customer_reviews.title: Zuch a deal!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff beats RoundUP all to what. I use it in a backpack sprayer. It's easier to use, and horribly cheaper than Home Despot Round up gallons!
customer_reviews.author: Pc Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this weed killer for several years now and have found it to be very effective. I have several acres and on a mountainside. Mowing is impossible due to the slopes. Because it is concentrated, you don't need much to make up a batch ... I use 2 oz. per gallon and apply with a high pressure tank system. I find it just as good as the name brand weed killers but at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff for sure, don't waster money on other brands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because is was the same ingredient and it was cheap. figured if it didn't work i wasn't out much. I use the lowest mixture and this stuff still kills everything out here in the desert of Tucson. It takes about a week for you to see everything die but after two weeks everything is dead and crunchy. Just rake or burn it all up and call it good. This doesn't keep new growth from coming but spraying again here and there is no biggy. Add some dye so you know where you sprayed. I use yellow or orange to keep in natural looking.
customer_reviews.author: jacob britton

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and works amazing
customer_reviews.text: I ordered some RoundUp to kill the weeds around my property. It worked okay, but once it was empty, I wanted an affordable refill. This was a great price and seemed to have good reviews. It was very easy to mix and place in the original RoundUp container that had a sprayer. The best part was that I could make it a stronger mix. I used it and it worked great! It killed all the weeds, even the larger ones that I had neglected far too long. Within maybe 3 or 4 days all the weeds were dead. I have a ton of this weedkiller saved for when I need to make more mixes too.
customer_reviews.author: Grace C

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap and deadly.  Just use it viciously.
customer_reviews.text: So I know most people will think of southern Arizona and think "why in the world would you need this?". Well let me tell ya.... I grew up in the south east and those Georgia weeds got nothing on these Arizona joker's. I give this 4 stars due to it's affordability. If you're like me and your weeds are tougher than a field full of zombies wearing body armor and flame resistant overalls than you need to double the highest recommend dosage of this AND double the dosage on the round up stuff, all in the same mix. After that, you can play hard ball but otherwise you're just waisting time and money. That was my hard earned lesson anyways.
customer_reviews.author: James Walker

customer_reviews.title: this is more fertilizer than weed killer!!
customer_reviews.text: followed directions to the letter and weeds actually looked good after a couple of days!! I increased to ration and still no good, increased more and finally the weeds show some distress. This product should not be advertised to kill weeds. I am bummed because I bought I bad weather with o weeds, now that I need it, I cannot return it . Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: dennis L. gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Just give it time
customer_reviews.text: I made a decent concentrate, applied, and was pretty disappointed. I was trying to kill pachysandra and per all the reviews here thought I would see results in 24hrs to 3 days. Two weeks later I looked outside and everything I sprayed was nearly completely dead. After a couple rounds the Pachysandra is dead and I’ve managed to kill a bunch of poison ivy, poison oak, Virginia creeper, and saplings. I’m glad because it seemed like every year my tree line was creeping closer and closer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to work on the few weeds it killed - very limited effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend this product. I used it as directed and was very patient but it only managed to kill less than 10% of the weeds (and species specific - most species were unaffected) that received treatment and it took a while to see even those results. I'm looking elsewhere for a solution and suggest that you do as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: works just as well as Rxxx Ux®
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works very well mixed a slightly higher concentration than the minimum sprayed a dozen problem areas thoroughly a week or less later grass and weeds dead have not reapplied and it has been 4 months of torrential FL rain and sun. Works well and is effective do you self a favor well latex /rubber gloves and a dust mask don't think I can handle anymore ambulance chaser attorneys trying to sue another company due to folks not following instructions or using common sense
customer_reviews.author: Floyd T. Turbo

customer_reviews.title: Bottle leaked and made a huge mess!!!
customer_reviews.text: The box was wet on the outside. So,after opening the box I found that the bottle had leaked. What a mess!!! I had to try to bag up all of the soaked packaging in the trash. I have to recycle.So, I had to clean up the bottle and get the dripping box dried enough to put in the recycling container. I wore plastic gloves but it got all over and in my shoes. There was no way I could mail the soaking wet mess back for a refund. I don't know if the product works since it all ran out into the box.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: Killed a quarter acre of poison ivy and English ivy brush just as promised. I mixed a slightly stronger concentration than recommended and had amazing results. it was noticeable withing days that everything was dying, it looked like it had been burned down. In 2 weeks everything was gone. One year later, I have seen NONE of the weeds return but desirable plants/untreated plants have returned with no problem unaffected so make sure to be careful about spraying only what you want to kill off. This product is effective and much better on your pockets than that OTHER one....
customer_reviews.author: Arnez Grant

customer_reviews.title: Killed foxtail, does it's job
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to kill off foxtail and some other very troubling weeds, as I bought a weed and feed which killed everything but these guys. I did my research and this herbicide had exactly the ingredient others stated you need to kill foxtail. I was so so so impressed when they started slowly dying off (many days and applications later) but I stupidly sprayed my lawn with it by accident ( knowing it was a lawn killer) and now I have a good part of my lawn gone. Strangely though I'm getting some small common weeds growing where I killed my grass...other wise highly recommend for pesky weeds, but not for unintentionally killing your lawn :(
customer_reviews.author: April Wright

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work at all for me. The weeds barely even changed color. This despite the fact that I added more concentrate to the water and spraying a second time. Even with a very strong concentration of about 7 ounces to a gallon of water and the weeds being relatively small, I saw no results. After spraying twice and after 2 weeks waiting for it to take effect, I couldn't see hardly any difference. Not only that, where I had sprayed the weeds and grass sprouting up, it discolored the small pebble rocks of my desert landscaping. This wasn't the case with RoundUp and it killed what I sprayed. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: aavi

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I try to be chemical free and only use vinegar, but there are some weeds that it won't work on. Finally broke down and bought this product. I used to use Roundup so I know how it works, this stuff in not Roundup. It does nothing, and adding insult to injury Amazon changed their return policy so rather than take it a mile up the street to a UPS store, I have to go across town to a shopping mall and drop it off at Kohl's. Next time it's Roundup from my local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: pdxster

customer_reviews.title: Serious weed killer- BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: This is the truth. I used 2 shot classes full of the products and killed all the weeds in a 14 by 6 bed AND a 22 by 4 ft flower bed. The first bed was FULL of only weeds. The second had some flowers, but the weeds had taken them hostage. A month later and the weeds have not grown back. I used a spray bottle with a strong, straight shot. It will kill anything it touches. The spray bottle allowed me to free the hostages without any casualties. The jug is going to last you a significant amount of time, but it now!
customer_reviews.author: Witty Wit

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it is 41%, but it is still okay.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this a few times for my properties. It is easy to mix and does last quite a while. However, I am convinced that it isn't 41% concentration as multiple times I have mixed it to the maximum recommended dosage and it only kills some species of weeds that were sprayed. As a control of any errors I was making, my GF mixed it herself using the same googled guidance and got the same result. Since it is inexpensive, I usually do 150% of the dosage and it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Cliftonious

customer_reviews.title: Epic fail
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions, even mixed it a bit stronger and my weeds STILL thrive. So, I'm forced to double the weed killer in hopes it will work. Won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works but takes a while
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but takes about a week or so to see the results. I get almost a complete kill on vegetative forbes and sedges. Less so on woody species, but still adequate. It's been a big help in helping to kill off the invasive non-native species so that I can establish native species for ecosystem restoration. I don't use it near any bodies of water and carefully follow the instructions. I haven't had any safety issues or seen any injured or dead animals, which is important to me. I still try to not apply to any plants in flower or in seed plants so the chemical is less likely to be consumed (in pollen or seed).
customer_reviews.author: Green Eggs and Spam

customer_reviews.title: Have Patience but it works great
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers I mixed this per the directions into a sprayer. I also added a a squirt of liquid dish soap as others suggested. At first, I was concerned that after several days I did not see the weeds and grass die. However, after two weeks everything (weeds, grass, etc.) has died. It has been about a month and there are no new weeds growing. The area I sprayed was a large gravel driveway that was full of tough weeds of all kinds. Bottom line is that it works, it just takes a little time.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Thank the stars for good generics
customer_reviews.text: Simply stated this stuff is generic Roundup. If you've used roundup your results with this version will be the same. Glyphosate is glyphosate and the concentration is the same with both products. The difference is that a 36 oz bottle of Roundup makes 6 gallons and costs from $20 - $24 bucks. This only costs $20 and makes over 21 gallons. The money saved paid half the cost of a rechargeable no pumping sprayer. This combination makes weed control manageable and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Kills what you want killed and nothing else
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my 13 gallon pull sprayer (behind my lawn mower). I had already made a connect for the battery to trickle charge, so the needed connection was there for the pump. This concentrate, used as suggested, takes about 5 days to see what it really work.....make sure its not going to rain within a couple days also. It kills my unwanted weeds and grass, while not bothering my plants and trees. Love this mixture, and have bought it several years running now with great success.
customer_reviews.author: R!CK

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work, Period.
customer_reviews.text: Used a double strength application, yet after 5 days, not even a sign of wilt or yellow. Have used Round-up and Eraser for years and thought when this product advertised the same ingredients; promised results; was a good price for being an off-brand, it'd be a good, cost effective solution. A total waste of time and energy. Other reviews with the same resuults suggested it may be a bad batch...that's even worse!
customer_reviews.author: The Truth 101

customer_reviews.title: Mix it strong- it isn't effective at typical ratios
customer_reviews.text: I've been using weed killer for years and I've wasted about 5 hours using this brand around our 1.5 acre lot. I finally upped the concentration to 6% of this product and it finally killed the weeds. Based on that ratio the one gallon size will make about 17 gallons of spray which is a far cry from the "Up to 85 gallons" claim. I typically only need to use a 3% mix with other brands so this actually costs me more to use than the name brand. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: Works just like the name brand product use to.
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to find this product. It's the real deal and a real deal at this price compared to the common name brand product. I'm on a limited fixed income and so appreciate good deals when I find them. This is the way to go both for effectiveness and price. I consider it a real score and should last me for years. I add a drop of dish soap to my sprayer to help this stick better and in several days the grass and weeds start dying just like the name brand's original concentrate use to work. Be patient and don't pull the yellowing weeds so as to make sure they are killed root and all.
customer_reviews.author: David AndersonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Too weak
customer_reviews.text: I wondered if I received a defective products, because it wasn’t effective in eleminating any weed even when I experimented with using it in full concentration. Total waste of time an money
customer_reviews.author: Boudi

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: I had used a brand from the box stores for several years that worked great, but it disappeared off the market. Went back to the brand name product. They must have changed the formula because it didnt work, even at double the strength. Tried this one, which was cheaper too. Even my toughest weeds went down within a few days. And at lower amounts of product so it will last a while. If you are looking for a glyphosate product that works, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT VERY RELIABLE OR AGGRESSIVE
customer_reviews.text: I usually use pre-made grass killer to kill anything green growing where I do not want it. I decided to try this to save some money. I doubled the mixture and found it either worked very slow, or did not work at all. The standard stuff you can get at Lowes or Home Depot works much better and faster. I gave it two stars instead of one because I may not be using it correctly, but again, if it takes more effort to figure it out, just stick with the pre-made stuff.
customer_reviews.author: JAGMAN

customer_reviews.title: Compare-N-Save Concentrate Grass and Weed Killer, 41-Percent Glyphosate, 2.5-Gallon
customer_reviews.text: This is great weed killer. Very good value for the money. I get 2-3 months non growth after using it. Just remember, it kills only existing growth. It is not designed to stop new weeds from sprouting. I follow the instructions for mixing for heavy growth and have not had any problems. Usually a 2 1/2 gallon jug will last me the summer. Highly recommend. It usually takes 7-10 days before I see the results.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Kills Plants Dead
customer_reviews.text: My backyard is all pavers and rocks, with red yucca and muhly grasses. And a palm tree. A very prolific palm tree that has resulted in little baby palms in hard to reach cracks and crevices - and right thru the middle of several plants. I did not want to risk using a herbicide that might kill the plants I wanted, so I mixed up a batch of this stuff and spread n the palm leaves. Two weeks later and.... Magic! Once their leaves died it was incredibly easy to tug out the palms, roots and all. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: This product works very good
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks after using this product for a review. There is some controversy on the mixing ratio. I used 6oz,/gallon of water. Probably more than you need. Sprayed on a variety of plants including 5ft poke weed. It took about a week to see some affect, but after that the plant kept shriveling up and dying. One application wiped out everything I sprayed. Also I put a squirt of Dawn detergent for a wetting agent. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: No one

customer_reviews.title: Useless Product
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed about this product, it is just waste of time and money. After one week of applying the product, all the weeds are thriving and it looks like that I have spread fertilizer rather weed killer. I waited till temperature was in the range and no rains, hoping to weed thinning and yellowish color none happened. Since I have used the entire container, there isn't anything to return.
customer_reviews.author: Alesoon

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, takes weeks to work even when strength is increased.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for 2 seasons, I cannot get a positive result even after 3 weeks. I increased the amount of concentrate per gallon of water to 6 oz on the advise of a professional who had also reviewed the product. It does not contain a defoliant just the singular chemical found in all other non specific herbicides. I do not know what to advice, some of the other products also failed. It took 7 gallons of various brands to kill the weeds in the front yard and a larger back one. The St. Augustine grass in the lawns did die wherever it was sprayed but weeds, ivy etc did not.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Allen, FIPF 2016.

product_meta.title: Compare-N-Save 016869 Concentrate Grass and Weed Killer, 41-Percent Glyphosate, 1-Gallon , White
product_meta.description: Size:1-Gallon| Style:Weed KillerGet to the root and kill grass and weeds with Compare-N-Save 41-percent Glyphosate Concentrate Grass and Weed Killer. Use for lawn or garden replacement, on patios, walkways, or in and around fences and gardens to remove unwanted grass and weeds. The 2.5 gal. container will treat over 630,000 sq. ft. with visible results in as little as 2 to 4 days. Kills all grass and weeds.
feature_bullets: Visible results in as little as 2 to 4 days
Makes up to 85 gal. of ready-to-use spray. Note: Packaging may vary

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars9,459 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
